verses.text: 約伯第二次受試煉又有一天， 神的眾子都來侍立在耶和華面前，撒但也來到他們中間，侍立在耶和華面前。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual trials or refining processes.
Refers to heavenly beings or angels in biblical context.
Formal term for serving a superior by standing before them.
Formal term for serving a superior by standing before them.

verses.text: 耶和華問撒但：「你從哪裡來？」撒但回答說：「我在地上徘徊，走來走去。」

words.note: Describes aimless walking.

verses.text: 耶和華問撒但：「你有沒有注意到我的僕人約伯？世上再也沒有一個人像他那樣完全、正直，敬畏 神，遠離罪惡。雖然你挑撥我與他作對，無緣無故使他傾家蕩產，他還是堅守自己的純全。」

words.note: Commonly used for 'servant of God' in the Bible.
Often used for reverent fear towards God.
Implies malicious instigation.
An idiom meaning 'without cause or reason'.
An idiom describing complete financial ruin.
Describes moral purity and completeness of character.

verses.text: 撒但回答耶和華說：「人以皮換皮，寧可付出他所有的一切去保命。

words.note: An idiom meaning one would sacrifice lesser things to save oneself.

verses.text: 只要你伸手傷害他的骨和肉，他一定當面褻瀆你。」

words.note: Refers to speaking irreverently or contemptuously of God or sacred things.

verses.text: 耶和華對撒但說：「好吧，他在你手中，不過，要留存他的命。」
於是撒但從耶和華面前退去，擊打約伯，使他從腳掌到頭頂都生了毒瘡。

words.note: Describes the affliction Job suffered.

verses.text: 約伯坐在灰燼中，拿瓦片刮自己。

words.note: A broken piece of pottery, often used for scraping.

verses.text: 他妻子對他說：「難道你還要堅守自己的純全嗎？你不如放棄 神，死掉算了。」

words.note: Used to express rhetorical questions, often with surprise or incredulity.
Refers to moral purity and uprightness before God.
The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible convention for sacred names.

verses.text: 可是約伯對她說：「你說話像個愚妄的女人。難道我們從 神得福，也不應當受禍嗎？」在這一切事上，約伯並沒有用口犯罪。

words.note: Implies lack of wisdom and discretion.
Used to express rhetorical questions, often with surprise or incredulity.
The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible convention for sacred names.

verses.text: 三友的慰問約伯的三個朋友，提幔人以利法、書亞人比勒達、拿瑪人瑣法，聽到這一切降在他身上的災禍，就各從自己的地方出發，相約而來對他表同情，安慰他。

words.note: Lit. 'three friends', referring to Job's three friends
To inquire with comfort
A transliteration with 'person' suffix.
A transliteration with 'person' suffix.
A transliteration with 'person' suffix.

verses.text: 他們從遠處舉目觀望，竟認不出他來，就放聲大哭，各自撕裂外袍，向天揚起塵土，落在自己頭上。

words.note: A symbolic act of mourning.

verses.text: 他們就七天七夜與他一起坐在地上，沒有人向他說一句話，因為他們看出他極其痛苦。

words.note: A biblical idiom for a full duration of intense mourning.
